0: A chance meeting six years gave a new lease on life to a Nicodemus man - literally. And, on Tuesday, Gov. Sam Brownback welcomes him and his friend to the Capital so they can share their story of generosity and friendship. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to the governor's office, Rob Robinson, a hunter from Mississippi, was looking for a place to hunt pheasant when he knocked on the door of Gil Alexander back in 2008. Four years later, Robinson surprised Alexander with the gift of a kidney donation that saved his life. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Gov. Brownback first heard their story last
